intro: Sarcophrynium baccatum, commonly known as the scarlet bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
